snippet: Passengers weary of the security and delays of airports are flocking to trains, which now dominate commercial travel in the Boston-Washington corridor.
abstract: Passengers weary of the security and delays of airports are flocking to trains, which now dominate commercial travel in the Boston-Washington corridor; Amtrak ridership nationally is at a record 30 million people, with the Northeast accounting for a third of that and virtually the only portion of Amtrak's system that makes money.
lead_paragraph: Passengers weary of the security and delays of airports are flocking to trains, which now dominate commercial travel in the Boston-Washington corridor.

headline.seo: Air Travel’s Hassles Drive Riders to Amtrak’s Acela
headline.main: Frustrations of Air Travel Push Passengers to Amtrak
